'Going out from Ambleside' was also broadcast by the BBC on Poetry Now. this section only - r.l. only unjustified prose with line-ends occurring as composed by the printer \n￼BLOODAXE/ Adcock page 2 copy attached page 20 copy and back cover copy still to follow (in a few days) L \n￼BLOODAXE/ Adcock PRINTER'S GUIDE TO PAGINATION Thispamphletwillnothavepagenumbers. Ihavethereforesupplied copy for each page on separate sheets to avoid confusion. The pagination will be as follows (& as marked on each sheet of copy): 1: title-page/artwork to be supplied when galleys are returned to printer -<^-2: publication details page/ copy to follow\u2014 ,nc 3: dedication page/ copy supplied herewith 4: Arts Council acknowledgement page/ copy supplied herewith 5 to 19 inclusive: poems/ copy supplied herewith 20: biographical notes/ copyvto follow ~7T front cover: drawing or bromide and lettering to follow when galleys are returned to printer back cover: co] to follow; photograph to follow; lettering (if any) to follow Neil Astley/16 January 1979 \n￼The author wishes to thank the Arts Council of Great Britain for a Creative Writing Fellowship at Charlotte Mason College of Education, Ambleside, during 1977-1978, which made the writing of these poems possible. Acknowledgements are seiaso due to the editors of the following magazines, in which some of the poems have appeared: Bananas, Gallery. IN Review, Poetry Review, and Poetry Wales.
